title: Find relative extrema given the derivative

content.question: Let f be the function with first derivative given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4DA8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. How many relative extrema does f have on the open interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>?</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F2A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

topic.text: 5.4: Using the First Derivative Test to Determine Relative (Local) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
